notes.text:
A security update for Red Hat 3scale API Management Platform is now available from the Red Hat Container Catalog.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat 3scale API Management delivers centralized API management features through a distributed, cloud-hosted layer. It includes built-in features to help in building a more successful API program, including access control, rate limits, payment gateway integration, and developer experience tools.

This release of Red Hat 3scale API Management 2.6.0 replaces Red Hat 3scale API Management 2.5.1.

Security Fix(es):

* ghostscript: -dSAFER escape via .buildfont1 (CVE-2019-10216)
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat 3scale API Management 2.6.0 release and security update

notes.text: It was found that the .buildfont1 procedure did not properly secure its privileged calls, enabling scripts to bypass `-dSAFER` restrictions. An attacker could abuse this flaw by creating a specially crafted PostScript file that could escalate privileges and access files outside of restricted areas.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ghostscript: -dSAFER escape via .buildfont1 (701394)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_3scale_api_management/2.6/html-single/installing_3scale/#onpremises-installation
Please refer to the "Mitigation" section of CVE-2018-16509 : https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-16509

notes.text: A flaw was found in the .pdf_hook_DSC_Creator procedure where it did not properly secure its privileged calls, enabling scripts to bypass `-dSAFER` restrictions. A specially crafted PostScript file could disable security protection and then have access to the file system, or execute arbitrary commands.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ghostscript: Safer mode bypass by .forceput exposure in .pdf_hook_DSC_Creator (701445)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

A specially crafted PostScript file could disable security protection and then have access to the file system, or execute arbitrary commands.

A specially crafted PostScript file could disable security protection and then have access to the file system, or execute arbitrary commands.

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: A flaw was found where 3scale did not set the HTTPOnly attribute on the user session cookie. An attacker could abuse this flaw to conduct Cross-site Scripting attacks and gain access to unauthorized information.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: 3scale: user session cookie does not set HTTPOnly
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
